text:
Super nice vibes! Service staff were really friendly too.

Got some bites and drinks. Chicken wings were tasty and flavourful. Chicken fried rice was very good! A bit oily but super fragrant. La zi ji and fried mushrooms were addictive, while lychee prawn balls were bouncy. The tea pot cocktail was nice with a good alcohol ratio.

Location is walking distance from Maxwell mrt station , do not know why google search mentioned it is @ Chinatown Point ? cafe has average setting outlook

Picked up a $20 voucher ( expiring by today 3/2/25) - friend went over to claim but was rejected as cafe do not honour it

The term condition is that they can anyhow change the rule - bad shop , wasting time ,and effort to go over for voucher redemn.
In the end , they gift a consolation free drink to compensate for the long distance travelling

Avoid this cafe , if you do not want to spoil your happy mood dinning or drinking .

Prince and harsh were so welcoming and friendly. They exhibited flexibility in the promotions and let me have the lychee beer which was delicious. Warm and cozy homely environment a gem of a bar along the many along Keong Saik road :)
sign showed 9/glass. went in and the person said it was for half a pint. do you think itâ€™s reasonable? such a let down. Atmosphere was mediocre at best. zero if i could rate them
